item.title: Meesho's Strong Market Debut: Shares List at 45% Premium on BSE
item.description: Top News Meesho's Strong Market Debut: Shares List at 45% Premium on BSE 4 hours ago Meesho made a strong debut on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with its shares listing at ₹161.20, a 45% premium over the issue price of ₹111.00. The listing price represents a gain of ₹50.20 per share for IPO investors. This robust performance indicates positive investor sentiment towards Meesho's business model and the growing e-commerce sector in India.

item.title: Marsons Ltd Secures BWR BBB-/Stable Rating, Reports Significant Revenue Growth
item.description: Marsons Ltd Secures BWR BBB-/Stable Rating, Reports Significant Revenue Growth 1 hour ago Marsons Ltd, a transformer manufacturer, has been assigned a BWR BBB-/Stable rating for long-term and BWR A2 for short-term bank facilities by Brickwork Ratings. The rating applies to Rs 35 crore facilities from ICICI Bank. The company reported significant financial growth in FY 2025, with revenue increasing by 2490.77% to Rs 168.40 crore and net profit rising by 4566.67% to Rs 28.00 crore. Marsons Ltd currently has an order book of approximately Rs 294 crores and is the only manufacturer in Eastern India capable of producing transformers of 132 kV class and above. Despite strong performance, the company faces challenges including working capital intensity, raw material price volatility, and industry competition.

item.title: Markets at Noon: Nifty and Sensex Slip Marginally on December 10
item.description: Markets at Noon: Nifty and Sensex Slip Marginally on December 10 2 hours ago Indian stock markets show a slight downward trend at midday with Nifty 50 at 25,832.00 (-0.03%) and Sensex at 84,628.37 (-0.04%). Key stocks buzzing include InterGlobe Aviation facing DGCA notice, Biocon acquiring stake in Biocon Biologics, Infosys expanding to Vietnam, ICICI Bank increasing stake in ICICI AMC, and Pine Labs reporting strong quarterly results. The market sentiment remains cautious with investors closely watching developments across various sectors.

item.title: Desco Infratech Secures Rs. 9.38 Crore Order from Gujarat Gas Limited
item.description: Desco Infratech Secures Rs. 9.38 Crore Order from Gujarat Gas Limited 45 minutes ago Desco Infratech Limited has received a new purchase order worth Rs. 9.38 crore from Gujarat Gas Limited for PNG installations and operations & maintenance activities in Surat and Valsad areas. The order includes PNG installations in Cluster 3C-Utran, Mota Varachha City Area, and Velenja Surrounding Area of Surat GA, as well as PE-PNG Operations & Maintenance Activity at Sarigam Surrounding area Cluster in Valsad GA. This order strengthens Desco Infratech's position in the city gas distribution segment and maintains their order book above Rs. 370 crores.
